title: Franky's Back Weakness is Intentional Character Design
theory: Franky's vulnerable back serves as more than just a combat weakness - it represents his inability to reach his own back, symbolizing the need for crew mates and allies. This parallels the broader Water 7 theme that no one can succeed alone, and foreshadows Franky eventually joining a crew where others can protect his back.
author: Various One Piece Community Members

title: Sogeking's Conversation Plants Seeds for Robin's 'I Want to Live' Moment
theory: Episode 260's conversation where Sogeking reveals the crew's knowledge of Robin's sacrifice is the crucial turning point that makes Robin's later 'I Want to Live' declaration possible. Without this moment showing Robin that her sacrifice was understood but rejected, she wouldn't have found the courage to accept rescue.
author: One Piece Community Analysis

title: Franky Kentauros Foreshadows Post-Timeskip Transformations
theory: Franky's ability to reconfigure his body into different forms (first shown with Centaur form in Episode 260) foreshadows his much more extensive transformations after the timeskip. This episode establishes that Franky's body is modular and reconfigurable, not just enhanced.
author: One Piece Theorists
